text:
The best Bak Chor Mee at Bukit Timah- Farrer area and some say one of the best in our little red dot!

The boss cooks with passion and is ever so generous in his portions.

Sometimes his food runs out before noon. Expect weekend queues.
Tried Fu Gui Bak Chor Mee today and it was so good! The noodles were cooked just right. The ingredients blend well together, especially the vinegar and chilli. I enjoyed every bite!

My favourite bak chor mee stall not open today, so I give this a chance. I tried their signature recommendation noodle. The noodle is cooked to perfection, but the chilli is really too oily for my liking. Fishball is very old school, tougher type. The fish dumplings is quite nice and fresh too. Nicely chopped fresh chilly.

The first time I am eating from this stall. The noodles were cooked just right and tasted great. Only issue is that the fishballs could be of better quality. The owner is also a polite and friendly person. Give this place a try.

Delicious bowl of fishball noodles. The noodles were cooked to the perfect texture and did not have any alkaline taste. The sauce used to flavour the noodles is delicious and not over-seasoned. Take note that this fishball  noodles is not the teochew type with vinegar.
